snippet: After the National Audubon Society released a report saying 650 bird species will be threatened by climate change, a report released by other agencies concluded that nearly one-third of American birds are in trouble.
abstract: Comprehensive study by nearly two dozen government agencies and conservation groups concludes that nearly one-third of American birds are in trouble because of steep declines across habitats and ecosystems; news comes on heels of National Audubon Society report saying 650 bird species will be threatened by climate change.
lead_paragraph: After the National Audubon Society released a report saying 650 bird species will be threatened by climate change, a report released by other agencies concluded that nearly one-third of American birds are in trouble.

headline.main: Federal Report Describes Trouble for Some Birds
headline.print_headline: Federal Report Describes Trouble for Some Birds
